news.title: Navigating the ‘unprecedented convenience’ of text messaging
news.summary: Text messaging is arguably the most common and convenient form of communication today, but medical professionals have been hesitant to text with patients given the labyrinth of HIPAA regulations and the potential to violate patient privacy.

news.title: Where Do MOC Fees Actually Go?
news.summary: Maintenance of Certification (MOC) is a process by which the American Board of Medical Specialties ensures that physicians are keeping up with developments in their fields.

news.title: Specialty Boards Profiting From Physician MOC Fees
news.summary: Costs to physicians for board certification and maintenance of certification (MOC) are substantial, and American Board of Medical Specialties (ABMS) member boards may be benefiting financially from them, suggests a research letter published online…

news.title: Medical board certification fees are excessive, according to JAMA research letter
news.summary: A physician who was fed up paying what he thought were exorbitant fees to maintain his specialty certification, decided to see where that money is going, and published his findings in a JAMA research letter.

news.title: Revenue Exceeds Expenditures for Many ABMS Member Boards
news.summary: WEDNESDAY, Aug. 2, 2017 (HealthDay News) -- Overall revenue exceeds expenditures for many American Board of Medical Specialties (ABMS) member boards, according to a study published in the Aug.

news.title: Doctors' hefty exam fees add to medical boards' coffers
news.summary: Doctors who have long been rankled by the fees they have to pay for certification exams won’t take any comfort from a new analysis that suggests medical specialty boards are profiting by charging those high fees.

blogs.title: FOAMcastini – Medical Texting
blogs.summary:
ITUNES OR LISTEN HERE
We interrupt our normal core content to cover an important topic highlighted in JAMA’s recent article, “Medical Texting and Protected Health Information. What is permitted?“
